**The Supreme Scripture of Original Cinnabar of the Dao Lord of the Cavern of Perfection**

**Transmission of the Great Youthful Lord**

The Three Venerable Lords—the Lord of the Grand Thearch, the Lord of the Supreme Heavenly Thearch, and the Lord of the Grand Tenuity Heavenly Thearch—each formerly received the *Supreme Scripture of Original Cinnabar* from the Supreme Dao Lord. Through its practice and cultivation, they attained the Dao, ascending to supplement the authenticity of emperors and kings. On the day of their ascent into the empyrean, the Lord of the Grand Thearch transmitted the true scripture to the Queen Mother of the West; the Lord of the Supreme Heavenly Thearch transmitted it to the Lord of the Upper Prime of the Southern Culmen; and the Lord of the Grand Tenuity Heavenly Thearch transmitted the true scripture to the Sacred Lord of the Golden Portal. The Sacred Lord of the Golden Portal then transmitted the true scripture to the Prime Minister, the Youthful Lord of Azure Lads, who in turn transmitted it to Master Juan.

This scripture is the *Upper Chapter of the Primordial Numinous*, a Dao of sublime mystery beyond the reach of middling immortals. Unless one’s name is inscribed upon vermilion tablets in green characters of the Great Ultimate, the *Supreme Scripture of Original Cinnabar* will not be encountered or perceived.

If a Daoist fully cultivates the *Three True Grades of the Supreme*, their rank shall be that of the supreme duke and chief minister above emperors and kings. Should their reception be partial and their understanding of the Dao limited, their station shall be as a king of the lesser numinous palaces, a minister of the divine continent, or a grand master of the middle or lower grades of the Great Ultimate. Yet even they may ride dragons and drive clouds, soaring through the void, escorted by divine officials and scattering their radiance to the eight directions.

Subtle and profoundly mysterious, it must not be lightly disclosed. The catalog of graded scriptures is concealed within the *Eight Primordial Chapters of the Supreme Hidden Writ*, subject to the constraints of reverent restraint. One must cultivate in seclusion and devotion, for the more earnest one’s resolve, the more swiftly the true person’s form shall gradually manifest.

Without your master’s sanction, do not speak of this to others.

If you hear the sound of flutes or horns in your ears, it is an auspicious omen of noble fortune. If you hear cries, wails, or shouts, it is an inauspicious omen of base misfortune. If you perceive foul *qi*, it foretells defiling or impure events—such is the verification of malodorous *qi*. Therefore, bathe anew, burn incense, and sweep your chamber in response, for this is the Lord Emperor’s earnest admonition to humankind.

If you perceive fragrant *qi*, it signifies that divine officials and numinous beings are at your side, observing your conduct. At such times, perform good deeds, practice virtue and kindness, relieve the destitute, accumulate hidden merit, and extend benevolence. The divine officials and numinous beings shall then report your deeds to the Supreme, revealing your virtue or its lack.

The subtleties of the Dao must not be overlooked, for all such signs are of this nature. If you perceive fragrant *qi*, do not disclose it to others unless they are your master. If you perceive foul *qi*, you should confess it to clarify your transgressions and the impropriety of your defilement.

If you smell the scent of blood or unexpectedly see pools of blood, it portends military calamity. Immediately retreat into seclusion among mortals, entreat the Three Primordial Lords of the Three Origins for instruction, and observe a three-month retreat in purification—thus may disaster be averted. These are the Lord Emperor’s revelations of fortune and misfortune, meant to inspire caution regarding blessings and woes.

Upon witnessing inauspicious omens, practice hidden virtue, extend kindness to save others, perform deeds beyond the capacity of ordinary people, and walk paths others cannot tread—only then may you escape the fate of certain death. Take heed and do not cling to convention.

Three *fen* inward from the space between the eyebrows lies the *Guardian Inch of the Twin Fields*; one *cun* inward lies the *Hall of Luminosity*; two *cun* inward lies the *Cavern Chamber*; three *cun* inward lies the *Cinnabar Field*; four *cun* inward lies the *Flowing Pearl Palace*; and five *cun* inward lies the *Palace of the Jade Emperor*.

For all methods of cultivation of the upper practices, first strike the celestial drum, cover your ears with your hands, and recite the incantation:

*"The Red Child dwells within the palace,
The Nine Perfected abide in the chamber.
Hearken to the divine command,
Ever vigilant against misfortune.
The Great One’s flowing fire
Extinguishes ten thousand calamities."*

After reciting, clap your hands over your ears seven times. If you feel warmth in your face, it is a favorable sign. If you sense cold in your head, neck, or shoulders, it indicates the entry of malign *qi*. Immediately lie down, close your eyes, and visualize the True Lord of the Great One in the *Palace of Original Cinnabar*, casting forth the radiant *Flowing Fire Bell* to expel the malign *qi* from your body. The firelight shall follow behind, illuminating your entire form until, after a long while, you are restored to equilibrium.

If you suddenly hear the sound of rushing water, thunder, or drumming in your ears, it signifies bodily exhaustion, extreme debilitation of the heart’s storehouse, and an inability to savor the true and nourish life, leading to dissipation. Thus, the six palaces lose their harmony, the hun and po wail in sorrow, and this foreshadows the onset of illness and death.

The *Muddy Pellet* has lost its method, the Nine Palaces are disordered, sorrow and disturbance reign in confusion, the drumming sounds in chaos, and the spirits seek to abandon their abode, forsaking the body. Upon hearing this, concentrate your thoughts on the True Lord of the Great One, restoring the focused sincerity of your true heart. If your transgressions are not profound, you may yet hear and reform. Deafness arises when the spirit of the ears has departed.

The ears are the Lord Emperor’s gates of hearing. The eyes are the sun and moon of the Great One. The nose is the hills and mountains of the Three Origins. The mouth is the crimson abyss of the *Vermilion Palace*. The eyebrows are the floral canopy of the White Prime. The hair is the forest essence of the *Hall of Luminosity*. The tongue is the dragon carriage of the *Peerless*. The teeth are the mighty power of the *Stomach Palace*. The hands are the external aid of the gallbladder spirit. The feet are the numinous gates of the kidney origin. The utmost yin is the true mechanism of the *Cavern Chamber*.

The single body harbors a hundred spirits, each with its proper domain—these must not be overlooked, nor treated with carelessness.

If you suddenly hear the sounds of gold and jade in your ears, it signifies the arrival of true *qi* and the imminent completion of the Dao.

If you suddenly hear the sounds of stringed music, the Six Ding Jade Maidens come to guard you—this signifies the Dao is about to be accomplished.

Above the space between the eyebrows lies the *Yellow Gate* and *Purple Portal*, the *Crimson Terrace* and *Azure Chamber*, jointly established to guard the *cun* on either side of the ears. To the left of the *cun* stands the *Crimson Terrace*, and to the right, the *Yellow Gate*. The True Persons of the Nine Palaces enter and exit through the space between the *Yellow Gate* and *Crimson Terrace*, guided by the Dao. Thus, the terraces and gates are placed on either side. These terraces and gates serve to observe extraordinary *qi* conditions and welcome the comings and goings of the True Persons.

The great spirit of the *Purple Portal* is named *Pingjing* ("Peaceful Stillness"), styled *Fawang* ("Dharma King"). The great spirit of the *Azure Chamber* is named *Zhengxin* ("Upright Heart"), styled *Chufang* ("Initial Square"). Both resemble infants, each clad in robes matching the color of their respective chamber or portal, and each holds a *liujin* ("flowing-gold") fire-bell.

The *cun* recedes inward by three *fen*, hence its name, *shoucun* ("guarding inch"). At dawn, dusk, and during meditation, first visualize the two great spirits, faintly perceiving their forms. Then call their names thrice, and softly intone:

*"Purple Portal, Azure Chamber,*
*Two great spirits, hands grasping flowing bells,*
*Bodies generating wind and clouds,*
*Flanking and guarding the true Dao,*
*Barred to all external intrusions.*
*May my thoughts and perceptions*
*Open the numinous gates,*
*Ensuring smooth and upright passage,*
*Ascending through the Nine Portals,*
*To behold the Nine True Ones,*
*And the august presence of the Most High."*

After the incantation, proceed to visualize the Three Ones, the Cavern Chambers, the Ninefold Dao, and all essential practices.

The two great spirits of the *shoucun* heed only the true officials within the Nine Palaces. When these officials, bearing the Mandate of the Supreme Emperor, or the Jade Lads, numinous perfected ones, sages, immortals, or any of the various imperial chariots, come and go, the two great spirits permit their passage. All others, being untrue, are barred from entering the inner palace. Such is the discipline of the *Central Yellow* and *Supreme One*.

Thereupon, the Infant Sovereign commands the ear spirits *Jiaonü* ("Delicate Maiden") and *Yunyi* ("Cloud Ornament") to guide them in. Thus, when one perceives ringing in the ears, it signals the arrival of an external emissary. Depending on whether the visitor is auspicious or inauspicious, *Yunyi* strikes the chime and bell to alert the Nine Palaces, ensuring vigilance against intruders. The chime and bell produce the very sounds that cause the ears to ring.

Upon hearing this, place your hands over your ears and intone:

*"The Red Child dwells within the palace,*
*The Nine True Ones abide in the chambers.*
*I beseech you to heed the divine command,*
*And ever discern what is inauspicious."*

Within the *Cinnabar Field* resides the *Supreme One True Lord of the Upper Origin*, along with the Sovereign’s ministers—a total of three—who together govern the palace of the *Cinnabar Field* and uphold the Dao of the Three Origins’ True One. This is the essential purport of the *Earthly Perfected* and the scripture of *Mounting the Dragon Chariot*.

The Heavenly Honored One often delights in becoming an *Earthly Perfected*. The *Earthly Perfected* retreats into official seclusion, untroubled by the toils of courtly banquets, thus moving leisurely and at ease, wandering as the occasion arises. They ascend in the *Seven Chariots* and tread the *Primordial Qi* within the *Great Nonbeing*. Though the *Heavenly Perfected* and *Earthly Perfected* differ slightly in rank, both are equally true. Each abides contentedly in their proper place, no longer aspiring to become officials in the clouds.

Within the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace* resides the *Mud-Pill Supreme One True Lord*. One *cun* behind the *Cinnabar Field* lies the *Flowing Pearl Palace*, whose true spirit is detailed in a separate scripture and governs the actions of the *Controller of Destiny*. Its Dao is profoundly wondrous; ( ) oaths and silk offerings are pledged, and covenants are sworn before it can be transmitted. This scripture is passed down once every three hundred years, and once bestowed, it may not be disseminated further. Such is the Dao of the *Supreme Polarity’s* ministers and the *Controller of Destiny*.

The *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace* is located above the *Cinnabar Field*, precisely one *cun* square, a purple chamber with green walls, filled with crimson mist. Within it, the *Mud-Pill Supreme One True Lord* governs the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*. The True Lord resembles a newborn infant, seated upon a golden bed within a jade canopy, clad in a purple embroidered brocade robe, with a belt bearing *flowing-fire bells*. These *flowing-fire bells* are formless yet radiate crimson light; when moved, their sound resonates for thousands of miles—such is the precious bell of the *Central Yellow Supreme One True Person* of the *Upper Clarity*.

In the left hand, the True Lord grasps the handle of the *Northern Dipper’s* seven stars, and in the right, the *North Star’s* guiding rope. The *North Star* is the unmoving pole star, known as the *Celestial Guiding Rope*. Seated upright in the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*, facing outward, the True Lord has no attendants on either side. The absence of attendants is why the title *Supreme One True Lord* is conferred.

At dawn and dusk, after attending to the Three Ones, one may then proceed to visualize the True Lord. This order—first the light, then the weighty—ensures proper cultivation.

A person’s head contains nine palaces; let us first describe them. Above the space between the eyebrows lies the *Yellow Gate*. After visualizing it, call the names of the Three Lords thrice and strike the *Heavenly Drum* twenty-four times. A thousand demons will submit, and ten thousand ghosts and malevolent spirits will vanish.

If a Daoist feels hunger or thirst, visualize the Three Lords, and from their mouths exhale crimson *qi* to fill your own mouth. Inhale and swallow it, and soon you will be sated. If a Daoist travels at night and cannot see the path, visualize the Three Lords, causing their mouths to emit three beams of fire to illuminate the way, and the road will instantly become bright and clear.

If one finds oneself in perilous or treacherous places, amid the dangers of blades and weapons, swiftly visualize the Three Lords, causing them to ring their jade bells. Concentrate and focus your thoughts, and enemies will naturally be seized with fear and awe, no longer harboring malicious or harmful intentions.

If a Daoist seeks to prolong life, attain longevity, and avoid death, or to be rescued and revived when gravely ill, compose the mind, lie down peacefully, and with focused intent, visualize the Three Lords of the *Hall of Luminosity*. Kneel facing outward, exhale crimson *qi* so that its light envelops your body, encircling your mouth. Swallow the crimson *qi* repeatedly, without count. Close your eyes and gently swallow it. Soon, the crimson *qi* will coil around your body, transforming into fire that burns your form. Body and fire become one, radiating light within and without. After a long while, cease—this is called *Refining the Form with Sun and Moon*, reviving the dead.

At dawn and dusk, when lying down at night, one should regularly practice this, and one will surely attain longevity and avoid death. Frequently visualizing and swallowing crimson *qi* will restore youthful complexion, making one’s countenance like that of a child—this is the Way of immortality, the essential secret of the *Hall of Luminosity* observed by transcendents.

Each morning upon rising, one should swallow saliva thirty times, regularly wiping the face and rubbing the eyes with the hands, visualizing the saliva as crimson fluid. Within the *Cavern Chamber* reside the Three Perfected Lords: to the left is the Lord of Non-Florescence, to the right is the White Prime Lord, and in the center is the Yellow Elder Lord. These Three Perfected Lords together govern the *Cavern Chamber*, and this is the Way of Ascending Transcendence, which is expounded in separate scriptures.

Within the *Cinnabar Field* resides the Supreme Perfected Unity Lord of the Upper Origin. As for the Three Ones of the *Mud-Pellet Heavenly Emperor*, they are the spiritual essence of the body, the root of the hundred spirits, the mountain source of fluids, and the jade chamber of the ethereal soul. Thus, the *Stomach Pool* is square in form to receive things, while the *Brain Palace* is round and empty to accommodate the true. Myriad hairs stand erect, and a thousand pores emit mist. Virtue fills Heaven and Earth, merging with the Great Mystery—hence it is called the *Mud-Pellet*. The *Mud-Pellet* is the supreme spirit above the bodily form.

Those who only know how to swallow *qi*, gurgle with saliva, click their teeth, and ingest fluids, yet do not understand their origin, merely grasp the overflow of the *Mud-Pellet* and the peripheral branches of the brain. Now I shall reveal to you the secret of guarding the One to hasten progress toward transcendence, so that you may become a Perfected One of the highest immortals.

Disciples who receive this scripture must purify themselves with sincerity for forty-five days before transmission. Offer forty feet of green silk, five bright mirrors, and two pairs of gold rings as the covenant of *Penetrating Unity*, swearing an oath not to disclose it.

One inch above the space between the eyebrows lies the *Hall of Luminosity*; two inches inward is the *Cavern Chamber*; three inches inward is the *Cinnabar Field*. Directly above the *Cinnabar Field*, one inch square, lies the *Mysterious Cinnabar*, the essence of the brain, the *Mud-Pellet*, and the palace of the ethereal soul.

Within the *Hall of Luminosity* reside: to the left, the Luminous Youth Perfected Lord; to the right, the Luminous Maiden Perfected Lord; and in the center, the Luminous Mirror Spirit Lord. The Luminous Youth Perfected Lord is named *Mysterious Yang*, styled *Lesser Azure*. The Luminous Maiden Perfected Lord is named *Subtle Yin*, styled *Lesser Origin*. The Luminous Mirror Spirit Lord is named *Illuminating Essence*, styled *Fourfold Luminosity*. These Three Lords together govern the *Hall of Luminosity*, all clad in brocade robes, girded with four jade bells, and holding a jade mirror in their mouths—both the mirrors and bells are of crimson jade. Their heads resemble those of infants, as does their form. They sit facing outward or toward one another.

This is the Way of the *Hall of Luminosity*, practiced by transcendents and cultivated through the Dao and its virtue. If a Daoist feels fear, they should visualize the Three Spirits, causing the jade bells to chime so that the sound reaches the *Great Ultimate*, and the mouth to emit a crimson light from the jade mirror, extending ten thousand yards.

One inch above the *Hall of Luminosity* is the *Celestial Court Palace*; one inch above the *Cavern Chamber* is the *Utmost Perfection Palace*; one inch above the *Cinnabar Field* is the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*; and one inch above the *Flowing Pearl Palace* is the *Supreme August Palace*. Altogether, there are nine palaces within the head.

The scriptures of the *Hall of Luminosity*, *Cavern Chamber*, *Cinnabar Field*, and *Flowing Pearl* are the Way by which transcendents become Perfected Ones, transmitted through the ages. The scripture of the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace* contains the essential words of the Perfected Officials who oversee destiny, serving as the leader of the four palaces.

This scripture may only be transmitted when the *Great Ultimate Emperor Lord* deems it permissible, and even then, it is granted only at the proper time. Those who practice the Way of the Five Palaces in the world and possess a true name will encounter it. Without the destined bone and fate, one will not hear these words.

There is also the *Jade Emperor Palace*, where the *Jade Purity Spirit Mother* resides; the *Celestial Court Palace*, where the *Upper Purity Perfected Maiden* resides; the *Utmost Perfection Palace*, where the *Great Ultimate Empress* resides; and the *Supreme August Palace*, where the *Supreme Lord’s Consort* resides. These four palaces are governed by the Feminine Perfected Unity, whose Way surpasses that of the Masculine Perfected Unity. Each has its own precious scripture, transmitted only to those who have already attained Perfection. Those who have not yet achieved Perfection are unworthy to hear of it. The essentials of the Feminine Perfected Unity are likewise not to be received lightly.

The *Supreme Lord* emerged from the *Eight Radiant Scenes of the Ultimate*, entered the *Jasper Terrace*, attended by three thousand jade maidens who served the Perfected and supported the chariot, with spirit consorts singing in harmony and divine attendants holding towels—all practiced the Way of the Feminine One, using it to ascend to the grand assembly of the *Mysterious Dawn*. This is the ancestral root of the *Supreme Lord*, transmitted by the *Spiritual Sovereign*.

These four palaces exist within all people, but those who do not cultivate this Way leave their palaces empty. Those who do not fully cultivate the Nine Palaces also leave their palaces empty—not only the four palaces of the Feminine Perfected. Within the *Cinnabar Field Palace*, the Emperor Lord is always present, and a great spirit guards the center, though one does not perceive them until cultivation reveals their presence. Those who cultivate become transcendents; those who do not merely live out their years and die.

The Way of the Feminine and Masculine Unity may be cultivated by both men and women, with no exceptions. Only through utmost dedication and perseverance will one reap its benefits.

The Way of the *Mysterious Cinnabar Supreme Unity Perfected Lord* requires that at dusk and in quiet repose, one dispel all distracting thoughts, sitting or lying as one wishes. First, visualize the purple *qi* of the *Northern Culmen Star* descending into the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*. Soon, the palace fills, and the *qi* overflows beyond the body, enveloping it and penetrating both within and without, merging with the purple *qi* as one.

Then, visualize the sun entering the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*, filling it so that it resides at the center of the purple *qi*, appearing like a fiery pearl seen in darkness. Next, visualize the *Middle Yellow Supreme Unity Perfected Lord* of *Upper Purity* descending from the purple *qi* of the *Northern Culmen* into the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*, seated within the sun. The Lord’s name is *Regulating Florescence*, styled *Transforming Mystery*, with attire and countenance as described above.

Finally, visualize your own body suddenly ascending into the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*, seated before the *Supreme Unity Perfected Lord*. Clad in whatever garments you envision, bow twice with reverence, kneel, and inquire of the Lord, seeking the Way of transcendence and longevity, speaking as your heart desires.

Then visualize swallowing the purple *qi* thirty times, completing the count, and swallowing saliva thirty times. Next, visualize within the Northern Dipper’s seven stars two crimson *qi* as large as the sun, descending directly into the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*. Thereupon, the *Supreme Unity Perfected Lord* and yourself together mount the sun and traverse the path of crimson *qi*, ascending directly to the *Northern Dipper’s* *Kui* constellation. Rest there for a long while, and upon waking from this meditation, true responses will manifest.

After fourteen years of this practice, you will wander together with the *Supreme Unity*, both reaching the *Seven Origins’* guiding principles. After sixteen years, you will ascend to the *Upper Purity Palace* to receive scriptures and wear talismans, commanding jade lads and jade maidens, eighty each. Perform this visualization every night without fail, counting only the repetitions—do not skip a single night. This Way may also be cultivated exclusively, without requiring adherence to the *Three Ones*. Combined practice refines essence more swiftly, hastening spiritual resonance.

On the first, third, seventh, eleventh, and fifteenth days of the lunar month, at midnight, visualize the *Supreme Unity Perfected Lord* within the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace*, seated facing outward, exhaling azure *qi* that enters your mouth. Swallow it fifty times, then swallow saliva fifty times, and recite the invocation:

*"Supreme Unity Perfected Sovereign, Middle Yellow Purple Lord, whose name is* Regulating Florescence, *styled* Transforming Mystery, *seated upon a golden couch within a jade canopy, draped in purple embroidery and brocade skirts, girded with flowing-fire bells to sever evil and destroy treachery, grasping star essence in hand, head bearing the sun’s true radiance—now seated in rectitude, exhaling* qi *for me to swallow, speaking with me, feasting together in the* Mysterious Cinnabar. *Refine and irrigate my seven po, harmonize and soften my three hun, that divine spirits may attend and guard me, enabling my ascent as an immortal. Let my five viscera regenerate, restoring my youthful countenance. Receive the scriptures of* Upper Purity *and serve as* Controller of Destiny *under the Thearch. May all wishes and desires be fulfilled, and a hundred blessings renewed."*

Then visualize yourself ascending into the palace, resting before the *Supreme Unity*. As you fall asleep, wondrous responses will manifest in dreams.

Through such repeated accumulation, one gradually attains the opportunity for encounter. The *Dragon Script of the Supreme* states: "Sit upright in the *Mysterious Cinnabar*, neither slanted nor deviant." This is the essence of the Way—you must constantly visualize the *Supreme Unity’s* purple *qi* swirling around your body and swallow it. You must also visualize the *True Lord of the Supreme Unity* residing within the *Mysterious Cinnabar* Palace. Thus, you shall attain boundless longevity, and no misfortune shall assail you. This is the culmination of the *Mysterious Cinnabar* Dao.

From the *Wondrous Scripture of the Pure Numinous Center*:
The *Lord of the Grand Thearch*, the *Supreme Celestial Thearch*, and the *Celestial Thearch of the Grand Tenuity*—these Three Venerable Lords—once received the *Upper Scripture of the Mysterious Cinnabar* from the *Lord of the Supreme Dao*. Through its practice and cultivation, they ascended to replenish the true essence of emperors and kings. On the day of their ascent into the heavens, the *Lord of the Grand Thearch* transmitted the true scripture to the *Queen Mother of the West*; the *Supreme Celestial Thearch* transmitted it to the *Upper Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen*; and the *Celestial Thearch of the Grand Tenuity* transmitted it to the *Sacred Lord of the Golden Watchtower*. The *Sacred Lord of the Golden Watchtower* then passed it to the *Prime Minister of the Azure Lad*, who in turn transmitted it to *Master Juan*. This scripture is the *Upper Chapter of the Pure Numinous*, a teaching of profound subtlety, not to be heard by middling immortals. Unless one’s name is inscribed on crimson tablets with emerald characters in the *Great Ultimate*, the *Upper Scripture of the Mysterious Cinnabar* will not be encountered or witnessed.

If a Daoist fully cultivates the *Three True Scriptures of the Supreme*, their rank shall be that of *Supreme Duke* and *Prime Minister* above emperors and kings. If one’s reception of the teachings is partial or their understanding of the Dao limited, their rank shall be that of a minor king in the *Palace of Numinous Lesser Realms*, a minister of the *Divine Continent*, or a *Grand Master* of the *Great Ultimate’s* middle or lower ranks. Yet even they shall ride dragons and drive clouds, soaring through the void, escorted by divine officials, their radiance dispersing to the eight directions. How subtle and profound—this must not be lightly disclosed.

The titles of these scriptures derive from the *Hidden Writings of the Supreme* in the *Eight Pure Chapters*, which follow the structure of celestial and terrestrial correspondences. The *Three Ones of the Mud-Pill Palace Thearch* are the spiritual origin of the body, the root of life for the hundred spirits, the mountain source of fluids, and the jade chamber of the *hun* and essence. Thus, the stomach’s reservoir is square to receive matter, while the brain’s palace is round and empty to accommodate the true. Ten thousand hairs stand erect, a thousand pores emit mist, virtue aligns with celestial power, and all merges with the *Great Mystery*. The *Nine Numinous Primes* of the *Pure Origin* are thus called the *Upper Treasury of the Mud-Pill Palace*. The *Upper Treasury of the Mud-Pill Palace* is the supreme spirit within the form of the Great Dao.

Yet if you only know how to swallow *qi* and ingest fluids, to sound the *Celestial Drum* and absorb saliva, without understanding their origin—these are but the overflowing foam of the *Mud-Pill Palace’s* upper stream, mere tributaries of the brain’s domain. Now I shall reveal to you the secret of *Guarding the One*, practiced in accordance with the twelve hours. Each spirit possesses a surname, given name, native land, palace, attire, and luminous hue.

If you wish to compound the *Divine Elixir*, you must visualize these spirits’ forms and colors:
The male is nine *cun* and nine *fen* in height, girded with a sash of five colors—mysterious yellow and pure numinous silk. He wears a cap adorned with seven treasures and vermilion jade, crowned with the *Infinite Wisdom* cap. He dwells in the *Crimson Palace of the Supreme Ultimate*, the *Uppermost Treasury of the Five Numinous Realms* in the *Mysterious Origin Hamlet*. His surname is *Lian*, given name *Xian*, courtesy name *Huangyan*.

The female is six *cun* and six *fen* in height, robed in a nine-colored sash of azure treasure, divine radiance, brocade, frost-silk, and luminous hues. She wears a *Mysterious Yellow Wisdom* cap and resides in the *Supreme Palace of Kunlun’s Great Seclusion*, the *Hall of Brightness* in the *Nine Radiant Realms* of the *Great Transformation Hamlet*. Her surname is omitted, given name *Hui*, courtesy name *Biyu*.

These two, when beheld, are the parents of the *Divine Elixir* that gives birth to great immortals. Before the primordial *qi* took form, before the five governances were established, before light and shadow were distinguished—there was neither limit nor end, neither above nor below, neither exterior nor interior, neither left nor right, neither before nor after. They are the primal ancestors of the *Supreme*, the parents of primordial *qi*, the ultimate subtlety of the *Mysterious Origin*, the unmanifest of the *Empty Ultimate*. From them, the ten thousand things are born, and heaven and earth endure.

If they dwell among humans, their lifespan is the longest. Those who can visualize them shall live a thousand years without aging, dwelling also among the Nine Heavens, where the myriad spirits receive their transmission.

When compounding the elixir, all ingredients must first be prepared with fasting, purification, and ritual purity. Once the elixir is complete, its efficacy will manifest. It is called the *Mysterious Elixir*, and the essence-water of a virgin girl is also excellent for its preparation. To compound the elixir, you must do so with a virgin girl in a secluded place. Three people should avoid contact with the profane. For three days and nights, erect a yellow altar.

In the east, place the *Azure Dragon* talisman to subdue wood essence, inscribed in blue;
In the south, place the *Vermilion Bird* talisman to subdue fire essence, inscribed in red;
In the west, place the *White Tiger* talisman to subdue metal essence, inscribed in white;
In the north, place the *Dark Warrior* talisman to subdue water essence, inscribed in black;
In the center, place the *Yellow Dragon* talisman to subdue earth essence, inscribed in yellow.

Erect the five talismans in their respective forms, then compound the elixir. The essence of numinous sand and herbal medicines may all be combined into the elixir. When a *knife-tip’s* measure enters the mouth, one ascends to heaven in broad daylight.

During compounding, beware of defilement—if the elixir fails, it will cost you your life. The oral instructions for compounding must not neglect the order of the Nine Heavens and Nine Earths. Know their sequence well:

The *Heaven of Supreme Purity* is the upper treasury of the Nine Heavens, the first generation, its *qi* pure and empty, the abode of the Most Revered.
The *Heaven of Pure Tenuity* is the uppermost palace of the first rank, the second generation, its *qi* subtle and wondrous, governed by the next in reverence.
The *Great Crimson Heaven* is the upper palace of the northern first rank, the third generation, its *qi* vermilion and cinnabar, ruled by the *Lord of the Great Yang*.
The *Great Azure Heaven* is the treasury of the *Mysterious Origin*, the fourth generation, its *qi* profound and distant, ruled by the *Lord of Emptiness and Non-Being*.
The *Great Mysterious Dark Heaven* is the palace of the *Northern Capital*, the fifth generation, its *qi* wondrous and obscure, ruled by the *Lord of the Infinite*.

The *Heaven of Great Mystery* is the northern first-rank palace, the sixth generation, its *qi* profound and silent, ruled by the *Lord of the Great Dao*.
The *Heaven of Grand Radiance* is the capital treasury of the Seven Governances, the seventh generation, its *qi* vast and boundless, all-embracing, ruled by the *Most High Lord Lao*.
The *Heaven of the Great Mysterious Capital* is the upper palace of the Northern Peace, the eighth generation, its *qi* pure and ordered, ruled by the *Lord of Virtue and Power*.
The *Heaven of Great Clarity* is the palace of the myriad yang immortals’ origin, the ninth generation, its *qi* luminous and bright, ruled by the *Lord of Supreme Purity*.

Thus the Nine Heavens are all pure, the Nine Lands stand in order, and the myriad beings flourish. Yin and yang, sun and moon, the four seasons and five phases—all follow their course.
When the primal *qi* abides in Heaven, Heaven becomes clear; when it descends to Earth, the myriad beings are born. Wherever the One dwells, all is luminous and bright.
Thus what Heaven values is the Dao, and what man values is the treasure. Heaven’s Dao is not recklessly bestowed, and man’s treasure is not carelessly spoken of—hence the Dao is weighty while man is light.

From the *Great Beginning* and *Great Origin*, the One is profoundly subtle, the root of all mysteries.
The *Lesser Yang*’s *Crimson Canopy* is the *Vermilion Palace*; the *Great One*’s *Yellow Court* is the *Great Crimson Palace*. Golden palaces and jade chambers, secluded passes and flanking gates—where the *Jade Gate* first rises and the *Jade Stem* first grows. The Kunlun Mountains stand atop the *Jade Tower’s* summit, soaring upward a distance of nineteen thousand *li*. Within lies profound subtlety: five-colored *langgan* jade. Above dwells the *Great One*, below the *Vermilion Palace*. It may manifest or vanish in an instant, born of the primal *qi*, all-embracing. When the Dao’s virtue is one, it becomes weighty indeed.

Man is born of Earth from the *qi* of the *Primal Beginning*. Without Earth’s generative sequence, the essences of the myriad beings upon the land would not dare harm man.
The first land is called *Primal Virtue*, its *qi* azure above and yellow within, governed by the *Minister of Primal Earth*. Its depth is eleven thousand one hundred and ten *li*, where all officials of the earthly realm reside.
The second land, *August Virtue*, is pervaded by blackness, governed by the *Deputy of Primal Court Earth*. Its depth is the same as above, where all earthly officials reside.
The third land, *Imperial Virtue*, is pervaded by verdant blue, governed by the *Earth Dragon of the Tiger’s Maw*. Its depth is the same as above, where all earthly officials reside.
The fourth land, *Kingly Virtue*, is pervaded by yellow, governed by the *Great General of Primal Heart Earth*. Its depth is likewise the same.
The fifth land, *Primal Virtue*, is pervaded by red, governed by the *Officer of Primal Blessing Earth*. Its depth is the same as above.
The sixth land, *Earthly Virtue*, is pervaded by white, governed by the *One of Primal Bone Earth*. Its depth is the same as above.
The seventh land, *Inner Virtue*, is pervaded by purple, governed by the *Parents of the Dawn Earth*. Its depth is the same as above.
The eighth land, *Returning Virtue*, is pervaded by azure, governed by the *Ancestral Rectifier of the Worthy Earth*. Its depth is the same as above.
The ninth land, *Flourishing Virtue*, is pervaded by green, governed by the *Two Thousand Stone Officers of the Celestial Axle*. Its depth is the same as above.
The count of their *qi* derives from the *Frigid Waters of the Great Cold Region*.

If a Daoist can thoroughly comprehend the two scrolls herein, they will commune with the numinous in Heaven and Earth. Thereafter, in practice, they will not undergo the trials of the Nine Heavens, Nine Lands, or Nine Waters; they will not enter the *Hill of Cold*, nor endure freezing chill, but will join the ranks of the luminous and pure among the six pitch-pipes in Heaven.
Should a Daoist disregard these teachings, they will descend into the Yellow Springs, undergoing trials in the prisons of the earthly hells, destined for the *Hill of Cold*. Though they may be ghosts, their forms will still suffer venomous torment, agony so intense it cannot be borne—such is the fate of spectral servitude. Their words may be false, but their suffering is real. Their descendants, male and female, will not live out their years but will meet untimely ends.
Moreover, in the *Ghost Statutes of the Blue Maiden* and the eight scrolls of the imperial decrees, ghosts submit of their own accord.
These two sacred texts must not be mingled with others unless inscribed on cinnabar tablets.

One must fully grasp the palaces and chambers within the body, the dwelling places of the spirits: one hundred eighty palaces, three hundred sixty joints, one thousand two hundred apertures, twelve thousand radiant essences, and thirty-six thousand spirit lords.
Here dwells the Most Revered, where the *Mysterious Sages* reside. The three *hun* and seven *po*, the twelve bodily forms and shadows, respond to myriad sounds.
Thus the reckoning of yin and yang is complete in the Three Origins: the head as the *Heavenly Origin*, the heart as the *Middle Origin*, and the kidneys as the *Lower Origin*—all governed by thirty-six thousand spirit lords. This is called the *Subtle Mystery of the Three Origins*, distinguished as left and right.
Hence: left is azure, right is white; front is red, back is black; center is true yellow.
The six pitch-pipes emerge from this, governed by the twenty-four *qi*, each with its own domain. The *Primal Elders* and their deputies number thirty-six thousand.
Transformations shift without end; though one may briefly evade a time, this is not death but merely a change of form.
Thus the myriad spirits are established among the myriad beings. When their forces converge and accumulate, they coalesce into human *qi*; when dispersed, the spirits scatter. Once the spirits scatter, the body can no longer move, and the true form naturally conceals itself.
Ordinary people, growing old, simply do not understand this principle and call it permanent death, wailing in grief. Yet this is no different from the hundred insects: on the first day of the *Beginning of Winter*, they all shed their skins outside their burrows, their forms returning to the earth. At the *Waking of Insects* in mid-spring, they emerge again, unaware of where they shed their skins—just like newborn infants.

I often see you all briefly appear in the world, yet you do not study the Dao of immortality, nor harmonize with divine medicines. Instead, you incur transgressions and endure punishments until your allotted time is complete, then return to your descendants’ bodies, taking form anew—how can you not understand this?
If you have committed transgressions, cultivate merit to atone for them, and make amends for past faults by observing the prohibitions and decrees. Thus it is said: when ancestors act with virtue, blessings flow to their descendants; when they act with wickedness, sins befall later generations. This is because their earthly punishments are not yet complete, and when their time is up, they return to the world to repay their debts—not because they themselves committed evil in this life.

Guard your words carefully, for the Examiners watch over you day and night. The mouth is the Gate of Heaven—do not recklessly transmit [these teachings]. To transmit them to the unworthy is to forfeit fifty years of your allotted lifespan.

By the statutes of the luminous code: on the day of *gengshen*, the six *po*-spirits of the body ascend to the Celestial Treasury and return to the human form. On this day, face east and sit upright—beware of sleeping or lying down. Pray thus: *"Spirits of the Five Viscera, abide in your palaces and chambers. Together, contemplate the proper method. If any leaks forth, suppress it: if it leaks from the head, press the feet; all depends on the master’s guidance."*

The arts of contemplating the viscera: within my body, the three *hun*-souls dwell in my liver on the left, the seven *po*-spirits in my lungs on the right. One hundred and twenty forms and shadows, twelve thousand rays of essence and light, enter through the Celestial Bridge of my mouth, ascending to Kunlun Mountain, the Prefecture of Fanyang, the Land of Non-Action. The Vermilion Bird leads the way, bearing banners; the Dark Warrior follows, bearing bells and drums. The Azure Dragon attends on the left, the White Tiger on the right. The Yellow Spirit of the Center wields the battle-axe. A thousand ghosts and ten thousand spirits prostrate themselves, none daring to rise. Ahead lies a cauldron of boiling liquid holding ten thousand *shi*; behind, scales bristle and claws reverse. May you, my lord, dissolve my calamities and disperse my misfortunes. As I pass through this time, I tread the Three Bonds and Six Relations, severing the demons—*hasten, as the statutes command!*

As a Daoist, you must listen and observe within your body. By its radiance and hue, you will know whether it is emaciated and *qi*-depleted, struck by the six vile and malevolent ghosts. At the hour when the sun is at its zenith, retire to a secluded chamber, close your eyes, and gaze inward for a long while. If you see a resplendent glow, bright and flourishing, then your body is robust, and your year will be one of vigor. Stop your ears and listen inwardly: if you hear the sound of metal and stone, or the tones of reed pipes, the five notes, bells, and chimes, these are all auspicious signs. But if the light appears faint and thin, or you hear wailing and lamentation, these are all inauspicious omens.

You must then compose and harmonize your spirit, and visualize the True Unity Lord returning to govern within your palace-chambers. Recite the incantation: *"My form is host to ten thousand spirits. Secure my palace-chambers; guard my Jade Hall, and let none wander astray. Guardian warriors at the gates, Central Youths—if any extraordinary being enters or departs, seize them and deliver them to the market square. Bind their heads and cover their faces; let them not stir—hasten, as the statutes command!"*

If you perceive your essence-light growing faint and thin, at the hour when the sun or moon first rises, face east and sit upright. Pray thus: *"Warm and radiant, warm and radiant, essence-light bright! I swallow *qi* and consume shadows, drawing them into my form. Support my body and summon the divine spirits. Let true *qi* return to govern, cutting off perverse essences. Grant me long life and ten thousand years of longevity—hasten, as the statutes command!"* Swallow nine times and cease.

If your body suddenly feels disquieted, your heart sorrowful and pensive, as though longing for something yet without clear cause, your mind restless and unable to find peace—this is precisely when the spirits within your body yearn to depart, longing for their palace-chambers. The three *hun* have already gone; the seven *po* take flight. Only the form remains, now mingling with perverse forces. In dreams, you may encounter women or men, exchanging essence and leaking spirit—these are all omens of death. Should such signs appear, you must reform yourself anew. Approach a Daoist libationer to present a memorial, and kneel in supplication to express your sorrow. Establish minor merits to soothe your heart and mind. From this day forward, observe the proper times for cultivation: pay homage to the Four Honored Ones, practice the Three, Five, Seven, Nine; the Two, Four, Six, Eight; the Eight Winds, Twelve Thunders, Twenty-Four Rains, Three Hundred Sixty Lightning Bolts, Nine Palaces, and Eight Trigrams. Do not mingle the true with the false, nor engage in improper conduct, lest the Examiners report you. After death, the Three Offices will grant no pardon.

When facing south, the Vermilion Bird of the South should face south, and the talisman likewise. When facing west, the White Tiger of the West should face south, and the talisman should face west.

When facing north, the Dark Warrior of the North should face south, and the talisman likewise face north. When at the center, the Yellow Dragon should face south, and the talisman face east. When facing east, the Azure Dragon should face south, and the talisman face east—all inscribed on peachwood tablets.

This Azure Dragon talisman severs wood spirits.
This Vermilion Bird talisman severs fire spirits.
This White Tiger talisman severs metal spirits.
This Dark Warrior talisman severs water spirits.
This Yellow Dragon talisman severs earth spirits.

*The Threefold Statutes of the Nine Perfected Illuminated Regulations from the Cavern of Perfection*

The Most High addressed the Celestial Thearchs, the Sagely Sovereigns of Later Ages, the Supreme Ministers and Azure Lads, and the Perfected of the Great Ultimate, saying: All later disciples who obtain sight of the Three Caverns’ precious writs or the first scrolls of the secret scriptures shall have their names inscribed in gold characters in the Eastern Florescence and recorded in the Upper Clarity. Though they may not yet soar to the Purple Court with reins in hand, they are already those destined for transcendence.

Yet even if they behold these texts, without knowing the *Nine Perfected Illuminated Regulations*—the protocols and standards of the Three Caverns’ wondrous writs and the Most High’s precious books—they cannot casually unroll them. These illuminated regulations, treasured and secret, are concealed within the Palace of the Dark Capital, in the Golden Chambers of the Jade Metropolis, and are not transmitted to the world. They clarify the profound mysteries of the Three Caverns, mark the rituals of the assembled perfected, deliver those with karmic bonds from the dark palaces, elevate the Seven Mysteries to the registers of immortality, interweave the threads of the ten thousand Dao, and dissolve the heavy burdens of the Nine Yin. Their wonders are attainable; when their statutes are put into practice, they instill solemn discipline.

Now, therefore, I reveal the threefold outline of these regulations to assist in the propagation of the Three Wondrous and Pristine Numinous Scriptures, that they may serve as admonitions to later disciples. Let those who aspire to diligence take heed of these precious statutes.

The Celestial Thearchs, the Nine Mysteries’ Sagely Sovereigns, the Supreme Ministers and Azure Lads, the Perfected Lads of the Great Ultimate, and the Perfected of the Great Ultimate bowed their heads and dared to inquire of the Most High Heavenly Worthy: The supreme and true methods are lofty, transcendent, and limpid, vast and boundless in their myriad manifestations; they are profoundly still and empty, their wondrous subtleties radiant and resplendent. Their teachings transform the Three Vehicles, pervading countless kalpas—who could be equal to them? How could one neglect the illuminated regulations?

The Most High replied: Your words are good. As for later generations, unless they are those of luminous emptiness who coalesce spontaneously from the primordial, all are conceived within the primal qi and tainted by the clamor and filth of the world. Their conduct is not purely formed, their natures not single-mindedly refined. Though they may yearn for the profound mysteries, their hearts often turn away from me. In all their actions, they inevitably commit transgressions. Transgressions arise externally, extinguishing life internally. Those who study in this manner—how far do they stray from the true!

If the Three Offices hold them accountable and their cases lie with the dark bureaus, if their seven generations of ancestors are examined and their sins accumulate upon their persons—those who commit such transgressions, if they awaken to the existence of the illuminated regulations with their systems of correction and punishment, and to the greatness of the sagely transformation that again permits methods of redemption, and apply them according to the statutes, then the time of their perfection will surely draw near.

For scholars of the Dao who lack these standards, their painstaking contemplation is in vain, and their bitter devotion yields no benefit. Now, therefore, I reveal the *Nine Perfected Threefold Illuminated Regulations* to be transmitted to later disciples who are destined to become perfected.

The Sagely Sovereigns, the Supreme Ministers and Azure Lads, and the Perfected of the Great Ultimate then withdrew, purified themselves, and journeyed to the Upper Clarity to receive the *Pristine Numinous Great Possession Wondrous Scripture and the Nine Perfected Illuminated Regulations*. They concealed them in golden treasuries and jade coffers, guarded by jade lads and jade maidens—three thousand each—who attended to the numinous texts. Incense wafted through the empty courtyards, flying dragons and venomous beasts, giant serpents a thousand fathoms long, brandished their claws upon the cloud-walls, standing guard at the Jade Pass. Thus did the Ten Heavenly Great Sages and the Perfected Immortals of the Nine Palaces, three times each month, ascend to the Dark Palace to receive the illuminated regulations and pay homage to the numinous texts.

The Supreme Minister and Azure Lad said: All who possess golden bones and jade bodies, whose names are recorded in the Azure Palace, and who obtain these texts must keep them secret and put them into practice. In this way, the rites of reception harmonize with the supreme canons, the protocols of application align with the true, and the methods of redemption and deliverance dissolve all karmic entanglements. The seven generations of ancestors rejoice, and one’s own person ascends to feast in the Jade Palace.

*The Upper Scroll of the Threefold Statutes of the Nine Perfected Illuminated Regulations of the Dark Capital: The Transmission of Scriptures*

The first scroll of the Upper Rank of the Dark Capital states: The *True Scripture of the Great Cavern*, the *Precious Scripture of the Feminine One*, and the *Most High Pristine Numinous Great Possession Wondrous Scripture*—the three wondrous chapters and the precious writs of the August Jade Sovereign—are concealed in the Palace of Great Possession above the Nine Heavens, within the Jade Chambers of the Supreme Mystery’s Numinous Terrace. According to the ancient statutes of the August Sovereign of the Highest, these scriptures are transmitted once every ten thousand kalpas. The three true and luminous Dao flourish daily among those who study the perfected.

The supreme and correct statutes permit three transmissions within seven thousand years. Jade lads and jade maidens, seven thousand each, attend with incense and tend to the numinous texts. According to the statutes governing transmission, one must face the altar and fast for a hundred days, swear an oath with a golden clasp, and assign jade lads and jade maidens in accordance with the statutes of the Four Poles. Those who transmit without following the statutes shall have their sins extend to their seven generations of ancestors, their dark souls condemned to servitude—swallowing fire, eating iron, bearing mountains, and transporting stones to fill the boundless abyss. Their own persons shall suffer the punishment of the wind-blade, their bodies perishing and their forms mutilated, eternally confined to the earthly prisons, never to attain immortality.

The second scroll of the Upper Rank of the Dark Capital states: For transmitting the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the True Scripture of the Great Cavern* to later disciples, the oath requires ten taels of superior gold, twenty-five catties of bronze, five pairs of golden clasps, one golden fish, one jade dragon, and one tael of green silk to bind the clasps.

For the *Feminine One*, five taels of superior gold, fifty feet each of five-colored brocade and silk, one catty of incense, and three pairs of golden clasps.

For the *Most High Pristine Numinous Cavern-True Mysterious Scripture*, two taels of superior gold, one hundred feet of purple-patterned silk, twenty-seven feet of green brocade, five taels of red silk, one catty of incense, and one tael of cinnabar.

The August Sovereign’s trust and oath must not be deficient; deficiency violates the statutes. If the master transgresses, the jade lads and jade maidens who attend the scriptures shall be returned to their original palaces. Within three years, the master’s body shall suffer the torture of the wind-blade, and the scriptures shall naturally be lost.

Those who receive these teachings yet fail to adhere to the clear statutes shall suffer the loss of their luminous form and endure mutilation. Their seven generations of ancestors and parents shall be consigned to the punishments of the Northern Feng, and for ten thousand kalpas, they shall be reborn into the paths of non-human beings. Let learners be cautious.

The third chapter of the *Upper Rank of the Mysterious Metropolis* states: All those bearing the golden name *Eastern Florescence* and the jade title *Upper Clarity*, who receive the *Jade Scripture of the Imperial Chapters of the Towering Empyrean*, the *Purple Metamorphosis of the Flaming Radiance of the Pristine and True*, the *Seventy-Four Methods of Upper Clarity Transformation*, the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected*, the *Eight Arts of the Hidden Earth of the Cinnabar Landscape’s Daoic Essence*, the *Jade Scripture of Dissolving Form and Transmuting through Flowing Radiance*, and the *Seven Transformations of the Heavenly Dance*—these are all the exalted scriptures of the Nine Heavens’ True Kings, the Primordial Celestial King of Origin, the Most High Celestial Thearch, and the Yellow Elder Lord of the Center. They were received within the Great Void, amid the Nine Mysteries, as the loftiest chapters of Non-Being. All are secretly preserved within the Palace of the Numinous Metropolis of the Great Highest, in the Purple Chambers, governed by the Three Origin Lords, attended by three thousand jade lads and jade maidens.

At the inception of the Primordial Origin, these scriptures were transmitted once every seven thousand kalpas. After the establishment of the Three Ways and the Rectification of the Dao, transmission was permitted thrice within seven years, and if a worthy recipient appeared within seven hundred years, transmission was also permitted. Transmission requires facing the altar for ninety days of purification, or thirty days, or nine days, and the scriptures are conferred only after a covenant is sworn. Jade lads and jade maidens are assigned in accordance with the *Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*. Should one transmit these teachings without adhering to the statutes, the sin shall extend to seven generations of ancestors and parents, who shall be consigned to the offices of ghostly servitude, compelled to haul the stones of Mount Meng to fill the River of Eternal Night. For ten thousand kalpas, they shall be reborn into the paths of non-human beings, while the transgressor’s own body shall suffer the torture of the wind-blade, the scriptures shall naturally be lost, and they shall never attain immortality. Let those who transmit be cautious.

The fourth chapter of the *Upper Rank of the Mysterious Metropolis* states: For the transmission of the *Jade Scripture of the Imperial Chapters*, one must present a golden fish, a jade dragon, thirty-two feet of green silk, and three pairs of golden clasps as oath. For the *Purple Metamorphosis of the Flaming Radiance*, fifty feet each of five-colored brocade, five taels of gold, five catties of aloeswood, one catty of true pearls, one scripture knife, seven golden fish, and seventy feet of crimson-patterned silk as oath. For the *Seventy-Four Methods of Upper Clarity Transformation*, forty feet of green silk, ten taels of superior gold, six pairs of golden clasps, one catty of fine incense, and a golden fish and jade dragon as oath. For the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected*, one must follow the statutes and cut off hair as covenant; now, ninety feet of white silk are used to substitute for the covenant, in accordance with the number of the Nine Perfected. One catty of green silk and twenty feet of crimson-patterned silk serve as the oath of the Sun’s Radiance; twenty-four feet of azure silk as the oath of the Moon’s Splendor; and three pairs of golden rings as the pledge of the Eternal Lad’s transformation.

For the *Eight Arts of the Hidden Earth of the Cinnabar Landscape’s Daoic Essence* and the *Jade Scripture of Dissolving Form and Transmuting through Flowing Radiance*, one must present ten taels of superior gold, one golden fish and one jade dragon each, thirty feet of green silk, and forty feet of purple-patterned silk, along with three pairs of golden rings each. For the *Seven Transformations of the Heavenly Dance*, five taels of superior gold, one catty of incense, and thirty-two feet of green silk as oath. The pledge must be made with sincerity of heart; no deficiency is permitted, for deficiency violates the statutes. The master shall cast the celestial pledge into the mountain retreats or riverine sanctuaries to succor the destitute, while the remainder shall be used to furnish the implements for the scriptures. It must not be dispersed elsewhere. Should the master violate the higher statutes, their jade lads and jade maidens shall be revoked, their lifespan and destiny records diminished, and their names inscribed for return to the Northern Feng. Those who receive these teachings without adhering to the statutes shall lose their souls and spirits, suffer the torture of the wind-blade, and within three years, the scriptures shall naturally be lost; they shall never attain immortality.

The fifth chapter of the *Upper Rank of the Mysterious Metropolis* states: The *Wisdom of Dispelling Demons*, the *Hidden Book of Jade Clarity*, the *Golden Chapters of the Absolute Mystery of the Soaring Empyrean of the Treasure Cavern*, the *Crimson Writ of the Eight Radiant Mornings of the Purple Phoenix*, the *Golden Perfection and Jade Radiance*, the *Numinous Writ of the Purple Text*, the *Golden Pendants and Jade Girdles*, the *Upper Scripture of the Golden Root*, and the *Orthodox Dharma of the Three Heavens*—these are all the treasured scriptures of the Most High Dao Lord, the Primordial Celestial King of Origin, and the Golden Portal Thearch. They are secretly preserved within the Palace of Jade Clarity, in the Golden Chambers and Purple Portals, guarded by three thousand jade lads and jade maidens, each attending the numinous writs.

At the inception of the Primordial Origin, these were transmitted once every thousand kalpas. After the establishment of the Three Heavens and the Rectification of the Dao, transmission was permitted thrice within seven hundred years, and if a worthy recipient appeared within a hundred years, one transmission was permitted. Jade lads and jade maidens are assigned in accordance with the *Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*. Transmission requires facing the altar for ninety days of purification, or thirty days, or nine days. Should one transmit these teachings without adhering to the statutes, the sin shall extend to the seven mysteries and nine generations of ancestors, who shall be eternally consigned to ghostly servitude without release. The transgressor’s own body shall suffer the torture of the wind-blade, die to become a lowly ghost, and never attain immortality.

The sixth chapter of the *Upper Rank of the Mysterious Metropolis* states: For the transmission of the *Wisdom of Dispelling Demons*, the *Golden Chapters of the Absolute Mystery of the Soaring Empyrean of the Treasure Cavern*, and the *Crimson Writ of the Eight Radiant Mornings of the Purple Phoenix*, one must present ten taels of superior gold, one jade tablet, one golden fish, one jade dragon, and forty feet of purple silk. For the *Upper Scripture of the Golden Root* and the *Numinous Writ of the Purple Text*, five taels of superior gold, one golden slip and one jade tablet each, measuring one foot six inches in length and two inches four fen in width, one golden fish, one jade dragon, one hundred feet of purple silk, and forty feet of green-patterned silk. For the *Orthodox Dharma of the Three Heavens*, forty feet of green silk, forty-three feet of green cloth, and five pairs of golden rings as secret oath; ten taels of superior gold as the pledge to commune with the spirits.

For the *Golden Perfection and Jade Radiance*, the *Jade Pendants and Golden Girdles*, and the *Hidden Book of Jade Clarity*, one golden fish and one jade dragon each shall serve as the pledge of oath. One must adhere to the statutes without deficiency, for deficiency shall cause the master to lose their jade lads and jade maidens, and their names shall be inscribed for return to the Northern Feng. Those who receive these teachings without adhering to the statutes shall lose their souls and spirits, suffer the torture of the wind-blade, and within three years, the scriptures shall naturally be lost; they shall never attain immortality.

The Seventh Scroll of the Supreme Works of the Mysterious Capital states:

*The Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny*, *The White-Feathered and Black-Winged Scripture of Aerial Flight*, *Treading the Celestial Net: The Seven Primes’ Stepping Rite*, *The Supreme Hidden Book*, and *The Numinous Flight of the Six Jia* are all the Dao of ascent into the void of the Supreme Lord of the Great Emperor and the Heavenly Emperor of the Grand Tenuity. The Eighth Scroll of the Supreme Works of the Mysterious Capital states:

For the transmission of *The Seven Stars’ Transference of Destiny*, forty-one feet of green cloth, seventy feet of crimson silk, ninety feet of phoenix-patterned gauze, and one pair of golden buttons shall be offered. For *The White-Feathered Scripture*, two taels of gold, thirty-two feet of green silk, shall replace the oath of cutting hair and smearing blood. For *Treading the Celestial Net*, thirty feet of brocade, one golden fish, and one jade dragon shall serve as the pledge. For *The Supreme Hidden Book*, the oath shall be sworn with a golden fish and jade dragon. For *The Numinous Flight of the Six Jia*, sixty feet of plain silk, six pairs of golden rings, and six taels of green silk thread shall be presented.

The celestial statutes demand sincerity as the essence of the heart; no deficiency is permitted, for deficiency violates the mysterious statutes. The master shall revoke their jade lads and jade maidens, erase their names from the Azure Register and Jade Roll, and return them to the Northern Feng. Those who receive these teachings without adhering to the statutes shall lose their essence and spirit, suffer the punishment of the wind-blade, and within three years, the scriptures shall naturally be lost; they shall never attain immortality.

The Ninth Scroll of the Supreme Works of the Mysterious Capital states:

All the talismans of the various Perfected Ones—*The Divine Resonance of the Square Yard*, *The Expansive Seven Primes*, *The Hidden Writings of the Eight Heavens*, *The Flowing Gold and Fire Bell*, *The Golden Spirit and Tiger Talisman*, *The Demon-Dispelling Branches and Trunks of the Night-Illuminating Divine Candle*, *The Eight Arts of Hidden Retreat: The Purple Clarity Jade Talisman*, *The Upper Talismans of the Six Jia from the Five Registers of the Cavernous Mystery*, *The Secret Writings of the Five Agents*, and *The Jade Regulations of the Mysterious Capital*—number six hundred in total. The Supreme Lord has inscribed their texts within the ancient scriptures to serve as the foundation for practice.

The statutes of transmission and oaths must fully adhere to the scriptural regulations. Any deficiency in transmission incurs the same punishment as described in the preceding scrolls. Possessing scriptures without talismans invites harm from celestial demons; possessing talismans without scriptures renders thoughts and invocations ineffectual, and the divine Perfected shall not descend. The statutes decree that neither may be practiced in isolation; those who do so shall incur the same punishment. Both scriptures and talismans originate from the qi of spontaneity and the intent of the Void and Nonexistence; thus, they cannot be cultivated separately. Without adherence to the statutes, the Dao shall never be attained.
